docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Regarding: ''For Group Doctors, a Winning Model'' (Feb. 1): The article fails to emphasize the primary reason for the success we've experienced at the Mount Kisco Medical Group: top-draw, unparalleled, all-important patient care. Yes, we are fortunate to have a savvy executive, financial and operations team.

headline.main: At Group Practice, Putting Patients First

docs.abstract: Dr Alyssa Dweck letter holds February 1 article holds Mount Kisco Medical Group is successful because of its patient care
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Regarding: ''For Group Doctors, a Winning Model'' (Feb. 1):    The article fails to emphasize the primary reason for the success we've experienced at the Mount Kisco Medical Group: top-draw, unparalleled, all-important patient care....

docs.lead_paragraph: WHATEVER happens in the race for the Democratic presidential nomination, the general election campaign is shaping up as a showdown between candidates with competing philosophies on tax policy. President Bush pushed large tax cuts through Congress in each of his first three years in office. Now, although he says the country is on a wartime footing, and despite the largest budget deficit in history, he wants to make those tax reductions permanent and add several new ones.

headline.main: Your Taxes; Pin the Label on Tax Policy

docs.abstract: Presidential election race is shaping up as showdown between Pres Bush and Democrats over tax policy; Bush seeks to make large tax cuts he pushed through Congress permanent and add several new ones; all of candidates for Democratic nomination want to cancel at least some of Bush's cuts; front-runner, Sen John Kerry, would repeal cuts for taxpayers with incomes of over $200,000 but retain those for people who earn less; Bush scores efforts to repeal his cuts as bid for tax increases; drawing; photo (M)
docs.snippet: WHATEVER happens in the race for the Democratic presidential nomination, the general election campaign is shaping up as a showdown between candidates with competing philosophies on tax policy.    President Bush pushed large tax cuts through Congress...
